{"step_by_step_thinking": "ANUG, or Acute Necrotizing Ulcerative Gingivitis, is a non-contagious infection of the gums. Treatment typically involves debridement, which is the removal of damaged tissue, and maintaining good oral hygiene to prevent further infection. Penicillin may be used if there is a severe or spreading infection.
